newsitem.title: JAPAN: Kansai Electric to introduce discount fee.
newsitem.headline: Kansai Electric to introduce discount fee.

text.p: Kansai Electric Power Co Inc said on Friday it would introduce a discount fee during peak summer months for customers who use a power-saving ventilation system.
The discount will be available for Kansai Electric's roughly 1,100 customers who have installed a thermal storage air conditioning system, a company spokesman said.
The system, which has mainly been installed in office buildings, makes it possible to store and use cheaper night-time electricity to cool buildings during the day.
Kansai Electric's discount will cover the three-month period from July to September, with the exception of weekends and the mid-August "obon" holiday.

In a model case, electricity costs for an office building with floor space of 3,000 square metres, would be cut by 30 percent compared to when using a conventional ventilation system, Kansai Electric said.
